question.title: WebLogic not picking up JAWR properties file in Spring Boot Gradle application
question.body:
I have a JAWR file in a Spring Boot Gradle application. The JAWR file is located at src/main/resources/jawr.propertes. I am trying register beans to handle the JAWR servlets with a config class:

@Configuration
public class JawrBootConfig {
    private static String jawrConfigUrl() {
    try {
        return new ClassPathResource("jawr.properties").getURL().toString();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        throw new IllegalStateException("Could not locate jawr.properties on classpath", e);
    }
}

    @Bean
    public ServletRegistrationBean<JawrServlet> jawrJsServlet() {
        ServletRegistrationBean<JawrServlet> bean = new ServletRegistrationBean<>(new JawrServlet(), "*.js");
        bean.setName("JawrJsServlet");
        bean.setLoadOnStartup(1);
        Map<String, String> p = new HashMap<>();
        p.put("type", "js");
        p.put("configLocation", jawrConfigUrl());
        bean.setInitParameters(p);
        return bean;
    }

    @Bean
    public ServletRegistrationBean<JawrServlet> jawrCssServlet() {
        ServletRegistrationBean<JawrServlet> bean = new ServletRegistrationBean<>(new JawrServlet(), "*.css");
        bean.setName("JawrCssServlet");
        bean.setLoadOnStartup(1);
        Map<String, String> p = new HashMap<>();
        p.put("type", "css");
        p.put("configLocation", jawrConfigUrl());
        bean.setInitParameters(p);
        return bean;
    }
}

When I run my app with ./gradlew clean bootRun, it works fine. So I then want to run my app in WebLogic locally (this mimics my remote server). I build my app with ./gradlew clean build, and it builds successfully. I then run my app with my run config in IntelliJ, and I get a long error, which is focused on the following error:

`Caused By: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: jawr configuration could not be found at zip:C:/oracle/WL12C_HOME/user_projects/domains/base_domain/servers/AdminServer/tmp/_WL_user/myapp_war_12.2.1.4.0/vx3l9q/war/WEB-INF/lib/_wl_cls_gen.jar!/jawr.properties. Make sure parameter is properly set in web.xml`

Worth Noting
- My run configurations are pointing to the exact location myapp.war is located, so I am confused as to why this is an issue.
- When I check inside of the war with jar tvf build/libs/myapp.war, I see the file as 588 Tue Oct 28 08:59:02 EDT 2025 WEB-INF/classes/jawr.properties.
- I see the error message complaining about web.xml. I am under the impression that I don't need a web.xml with Spring Boot even if I'm running my app in WebLogic, but I could be wrong about that.
- Stack:

  • Java 8
  • Spring Boot 2.7
  • Gradle 7.6.4
  • WebLogic 12.2.1.4.0

Any idea how I can get my JAWR properties file to get recognized when I run my app in Spring Boot? I can provide more information if need be. Thanks!

answers.body:
The root of your problem is this line: return new ClassPathResource("jawr.properties").getURL().toString();

When you run this inside WebLogic, it resolves to a complex, container-specific URL that Jawr doesn't understand: zip:C:/.../_wl_cls_gen.jar!/jawr.properties

WebLogic is telling you it's trying to find the file inside a temporary generated JAR, which is not correct. The Jawr servlet is getting confused by this non-standard zip: protocol.

Try this code

private static String jawrConfigUrl() {
    return "classpath:/jawr.properties";
}
